content.html:
Bill Bishop is thinking about introducing advertising on to his Substack.

‚ÄúThe Substack model of ‚Äúonly ads‚Äù doesn‚Äôt make much sense long term for most writers. Even if they convert 10% of their audience, they‚Äôre making no money from 90%. Most businesses don‚Äôt operate that way.

This is not wrong, but I hope what Bishop means is what I call @gruber style advertising - and not seeking to ‚Äòtrack the tar out of us‚Äô.

I also wonder how he will handle paid subscriptions (I‚Äôm not a paid subscriber of Sinocism) - will they see the ads aswell?

(Apologies. lost the source where I read this ‚Ä¶ it was a Substack newsletter)
